about.description:
ASTROALIGN is a python module that will try to align two stellar
astronomical images, especially when there is no WCS information available.

It does so by finding similar 3-point asterisms (triangles) in both images
and deducing the affine transformation between them.
about.summary: A tool to align astronomical images based on asterism matching

about.description:
ASTROALIGN is a python module that will try to align two stellar
astronomical images, especially when there is no WCS information available.

It does so by finding similar 3-point asterisms (triangles) in both images
and deducing the affine transformation between them.
about.summary: A tool to align astronomical images based on asterism matching

name: astroalign

new_version_errors.2.3:
The recipe did not change in the version migration, a URL did not hash, or there is jinja2 syntax the bot cannot handle!

Please check the URLs in your recipe with version '2.3' to make sure they exist!

We also found the following errors:

 - could not hash URL template 'https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz'

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "astroalign" %}
{% set version = "2.2" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: db027dae2a2e21f7123b854ae3dd591d1b31914e0c0f7648b425056833246c24

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - pip
    - python
  run:
    - numpy >=1.6.2
    - python >=3.5
    - scikit-image
    - scipy >=0.15
    - sep

test:
  imports:
    - astroalign

about:
  home: https://astroalign.readthedocs.io/
  license: MIT
  license_family: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: A tool to align astronomical images based on asterism matching
  description: |
    ASTROALIGN is a python module that will try to align two stellar
    astronomical images, especially when there is no WCS information available.

    It does so by finding similar 3-point asterisms (triangles) in both images
    and deducing the affine transformation between them.
  doc_url: https://astroalign.readthedocs.io/
  dev_url: https://github.com/toros-astro/astroalign

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - mwcraig
